sub_title: Postdoc Researcher at TU Delft | Additive Manufacturing | Transformative Energy Technologies
summary:
I am a postdoctoral researcher at TU Delft, performing fundamental and applied research on advanced multiscale modelling of complex heat and fluid flow problems. I have extensive experience covering metallurgy and materials processing (welding and additive manufacturing), thermal energy systems, and Micro/Nano-fluidic devices. My research interest lies in understanding the physics of complex fluids and complex flows and employing this knowledge in the development of novel technologies, and am particularly interested in data-driven engineering and optimisation for real-world engineering problems. I enthusiastically explore new ideas, search for novel solutions, and actively apply my knowledge and expertise for effective problem-solving. 

I am open to collaborative research related to my field of interest for the benefit of industry and society. Please refer to my current and past projects and publications for further details and feel free to contact me at "A.Ebrahimi@tudelft.nl" or "Ebrahimi.Amin@gmail.com".

profile_positions.description:
Ongoing activities:
• Theoretical and experimental study of defect formation susceptibility in fusion-based welding and additive manufacturing
• Microstructural control and functional grading in metal additive manufacturing
• Computational analysis of advanced materials processing (e.g. fusion welding and additive manufacturing)
• Design and development of new additive manufacturing techniques
• Optimisation of additive manufacturing processes for non-metallic materials (e.g. polymers)

Research grant recipient:
• Successfully secured funding for the project titled "Digital Twin-Enabled Optimization of Electric Vehicle Battery Pack Housing Manufacturing (BatHMan)"
• Collaborated with researchers from TU Delft and IIT Delhi to develop innovative manufacturing techniques for electric vehicle battery pack housing
• Conducted research activities, executed experiments, and analysed data to achieve project goals
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Research activities:
• Microstructural control and functional grading in metal additive manufacturing (laser-based direct energy deposition, and wire-arc additive manufacturing)
• Computational analysis of advanced laser processing of metallic materials
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• Joining and Additive Manufacturing Technologies (MSc level)
• Processing of Materials (MSc level)
• Mechanics of Materials (BSc level)
• Joining and Additive Manufacturing Laboratory (BSc level)
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Extensive experience covering:
• Advanced computational modelling of complex heat and fluid flow in metallurgy and materials processing
• Developing simulation-based methodologies for investigating hydrodynamic instabilities in welding and additive manufacturing
• Utilising data-driven approaches to optimise advanced fusion-based welding and additive manufacturing processes
• Analysing molten metal droplet deposition in additive manufacturing (3D-Printing)
• Executing experimental studies to explore the design space for wire-arc additive manufacturing
• Assessing the performance, reliability and validity of numerical models in describing thermophysical phenomena
• Numerical study of solidification and melting processes
• Numerical study of multi-phase fluid flow dynamics
• Translating research findings into pragmatic solutions benefiting both industry and society 

Ancillary activities:
• Supervising master's and bachelor's graduation projects
• Configuring, setting up and maintaining the MSE-Welding high-performance computing (HPC) cluster
• Writing research grant project proposals
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer and Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Session Chair, [Advanced Technology] Laser Process, The 75th IIW Annual Assembly and International 

As the chairperson, I had the honour of leading and moderating discussions among industry experts and researchers. With a focus on cutting-edge laser technologies and their applications, the session explored advancements, challenges, and future trends in the field.
profile_positions.title: Chairperson

profile_positions.description:
Project: Developing a new simulation-based approach to welding process optimisation
This project was carried out in the framework of the Partnership Program of the Materials innovation institute M2i and the Foundation for Fundamental Research on Matter (FOM), which is part of the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research.

• Investigation of fluid dynamics and heat transfer at microscales
• Executing high-performance numerical simulations

• Numerical simulation of transverse jet interactions with high-speed (supersonic) crossflows

• Supervising bachelor's graduation research projects

volunteer_experiences.description:
Invited peer-reviewer for scientific articles
Records are available at: https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/record/1211696
Tubalkaïn is the student association of the Materials Science and Engineering Department of TU Delft.

Special Issue "The Physics of Joining and Additive Manufacturing"
Link: https://www.mdpi.com/journal/applsci/special_issues/80839160HW

Frontiers in Manufacturing Technology—Additive Processes
Open for submission: https://rb.gy/bzsnp8

Frontiers in Materials—Computational Materials Science
Open for submission: https://rb.gy/nyunpo

As the chairperson for the "[Advanced Technology] Laser Process" session at the prestigious 75th IIW Annual Assembly and International Conference, I had the honour of leading and moderating discussions among industry experts and researchers. With a focus on cutting-edge laser technologies and their applications, the session explored advancements, challenges, and future trends in the field.
